newsitem.title: USA: ConAgra splits stock two-for-one, names Rohde CEO.
newsitem.headline: ConAgra splits stock two-for-one, names Rohde CEO.

text.p: ConAgra Inc. said Friday it named its president, Bruce Rohde, 48, to the additional post of chief executive officer, as of Sept. 25.
He succeeds Philip Fletcher, 64, who remains chairman of the Omaha, Neb.-based diversified food company.
Conagra also announced a two-for-one stock split in the form of a stock dividend that is effective Oct. 1 for shareholders of record as of Sept. 5.
"It's been anticipated," Dain Bosworth analyst Bonnie Wittenburg said of Rohde's appointment as CEO.
Rohde joined ConAgra in August 1996 as vice chairman and president. He previously was president of Omaha-based law firm McGrath, North, Mullin & Kratz PC and had been ConAgra's general counsel.

Goldman Sachs analyst Nomi Ghez said Fletcher, who has been chairman since May 1993 and became CEO in September 1992, has told analysts he expects to retire next summer. Ghez said that Rohde had been previously identified as the heir apparent.
ConAgra shares rose $2.625 to $67.50 on the New York Stock Exchange in early afternoon trading.
